 We have received the following response from our R&D team.
 
 The error "unable to qualify my own domain name" typically means that the system or mail server cannot determine its fully qualified domain name (FQDN). This usually happens due to misconfigured hostname settings.
 
 Receiving the email from "root@eppserver" it's normal behavior. The service used to send email is one from the system and by default, when the message is received, the FROM email address will appear as your user@server. In our case, root@eppserver.

Hello Lokesh, 
 
 Thank you for getting back to us.
 
 We received an update from our Engineering team that starting with the 5940 version  modification will be applied only for email alternative transport.
 We added a checkbox to enable the use of a custom sender and a custom sender email input to be displayed when TLS 1.3 is checked on System Settings --> E-mail server Settings or e-mail configuration wizard.
 If the checkbox to enable the custom sender is checked and a custom email is provided, then the 'From' attribute will have the provided custom email address.
 If the checkbox to enable the custom sender is not checked or if the checkbox is checked but the custom sender address is not provided, then the 'From' attribute will have root@eppserver (in our case).
 The No-reply email address option will be hidden when TLS 1.3 is checked.
 
 Note:
 Depending on the organization's Anti-spam filter policy, using a custom sender for alternative transport may cause the emails to be labeled as Phishing or Spam and sent to Quarantine.
 The usage of a system service to send emails will still set root@eppserver (in our case) as the sender in mail.log and email headers because it is normal behavior. The provided custom sender address will be used only for the email "From" header.
 
 Please test with this steps and let us know if you receive emails from the custom address you setup ?
 
 Have a nice day ahead!

We added a checkbox to enable the use of a custom sender and a custom sender email input to be displayed when TLS 1.3 is checked on System Settings --> E-mail server Settings or e-mail configuration wizard.

The No-reply email address option will be hidden when TLS 1.3 is checked.

Note:

The usage of a system service to send emails will still set root@eppserver (in our case) as the sender in mail.log and email headers because it is normal behavior. The provided custom sender address will be used only for the email "From" header.

We added a checkbox to enable the use of a custom sender and a custom sender email input to be displayed when TLS 1.3 is checked on System Settings --> E-mail server Settings or e-mail configuration wizard.

If the checkbox to enable the custom sender is not checked or if the checkbox is checked but the custom sender address is not provided, then the 'From' attribute will have root@eppserver (in our case).

The usage of a system service to send emails will still set root@eppserver (in our case) as the sender in mail.log and email headers because it is normal behavior. The provided custom sender address will be used only for the email "From" header.
